text: Rick Derringer (born Richard Dean Zehringer; August 5, 1947 â€“ May 26, 2025) was an American musician, producer, and songwriter. He was known for being a member of the McCoys. After releasing All American Boy, Derringer became a solo artist. Derringer later became known for his 1973 song "Rock and Roll, Hoochie Koo". He worked with brothers Edgar and Johnny Winter, producing all of their gold and platinum records, including Edgar Winter's hits "Frankenstein" and "Free Ride" (both in 1973). Derringer also worked with Steely Dan, Cyndi Lauper, and "Weird Al" Yankovic, producing Yankovic's Grammy Award-winning songs "Eat It" (1984) and "Fat" (1988). Derringer died on May 26, 2025 in Ormond Beach, Florida from heart failure at the age of 77. He had undergone a triple heart bypass surgery just two months before his death. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website * Rick Derringer biography by Bruce Eder, discography and album reviews, credits & releases at AllMusic * Rick Derringer discography, album releases & credits at Discogs * * Rick Derringer albums to be listened to on Spotify * Rick Derringer songs & albums to be listened to on YouTube Category:1947 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American rock singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American blues singers Category:American blues musicians Category:American pop singers Category:American pop musicians Category:American record producers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Musicians from Ohio Category:Singers from Ohio Category:Writers from Ohio Category:Businesspeople from Ohio
title: Rick Derringer
